intro_text.base: The forest edge looms before you. Between the black pines, something moves. Not quite in sync with the wind. You catch a glimpse of pale skin, wrong angles. It knows you're watching.

lens.believer: The Entity manifests. The aurora flickers overhead, and in its green light, you see faces in the darkness between the trees. Hungry. Waiting.
lens.skeptic: Someone is out there. Possibly armed. The cold plays tricks, but those are human movements. Someone else is investigating. Or hunting.
lens.haunted: You've seen this before. In Blackwood. In your nightmares. The shape resolving from shadows. It always comes for you.

options.label: Back away slowly
options.description: Don't run. Don't break eye contact. Just... step back.

success.text: You keep your breathing steady. One step back. Two. The shape doesn't follow. It tilts its head, curious, but lets you go. This time.

failure.text: Your foot catches a root. You stumble. In that moment of weakness, it surges forward.

partial.text: You manage to back away, but something in the way it watches you... it learned something. About you. About your fear.

options.label: Run for town
options.description: Forget caution. Get back to the lights.

success.text: You sprint through the snow, lungs burning with cold air. The street lights of Kaltvik appear ahead. You don't look back.

failure.text: The snow is deep here. Your legs burn. You hear it behind you, matching your pace. Playing with you.

partial.text: You make it to the road, gasping, but something cold brushes your neck as you flee. A touch. A claim.

options.label: Use flashlight
options.description: Light reveals truth. Or so you hope.

success.text: The beam catches... nothing. No, wait. Footprints in the snow. Human footprints. Leading deeper into the forest. Whatever was here, it's gone now. Or hiding.

failure.text: The light flickers, batteries fading in the cold. In the strobe effect, you see it clearly for one terrible instant. Then darkness.

partial.text: The light holds, but it doesn't dispel the presence. It illuminates instead: a face, pale and wrong, watching from between the trees. Then it's gone. You saw too much.

options.label: Call out to it
options.description: Maybe it's human. Maybe it needs help. Maybe you can reason with it.

success.text: "Hello?" Your voice cracks in the cold. Silence. Then, distant: "...help me." A woman's voice. Human. Lost in the forest. The presence fades.

failure.text: Your voice echoes. Nothing responds. But you feel its attention sharpen. You've invited it. You've acknowledged it.

partial.text: It answers. Not in words. In sensation: cold fingers tracing your spine, though nothing touches you. It understood. It responded.

options.label: Find cover
options.description: Crouch behind a snowdrift. Don't move. Don't breathe.

success.text: You press into the snow, ice crystals burning your skin. Minutes pass. The presence drifts past, searching, then moves deeper into the forest. Gone. For now.

failure.text: The snow shifts. You sink. A branch snaps. It knows. It's coming.

partial.text: You're hidden, but trapped. It circles your position, not seeing you but knowing. You'll have to wait until it loses interest. The cold bites deep.

action.text: The shape moves between the trees, methodical, patient. Searching. Each moment brings it closer to finding you.
It stops. Turns toward you. Though you can't see eyes, you feel its gaze. Then it begins walking. Toward you.
It doesn't walk. It glides. The snow doesn't crunch under its feet. The distance shrinks impossibly fast.
It's here. Right here. You smell frost and something else. Something organic. Rotting. A hand—if it is a hand—reaches toward your face.
Contact. Cold beyond cold. Your vision whites out. When it clears, you're on the ground. It's gone. But something is different. Something is missing. You can't remember what.

effect.text: The arctic cold seeps through your clothing. Your extremities are going numb.
The aurora flares overhead. For a moment, the world is painted in shifting green. In that light, you see more shapes in the forest. Many more.

result.text: You made it back to Kaltvik. The street lights feel like sanctuary. But the memory of what you saw will not fade.
Dawn is coming. The shapes withdraw into the deeper forest, as if the approaching light burns them. You survive the night.
The presence fades. Whether you drove it away or it simply lost interest, you're alone again. The forest is just a forest. Almost.
The touch of the Entity. Reality fractures. When you wake, you're somewhere else. Somewhere... other.
